com.emc.atmos.sync.plugins
Class MultithreadedCrawlSource

java.lang.Object
  com.emc.atmos.sync.plugins.SyncPlugin
      com.emc.atmos.sync.plugins.SourcePlugin
          com.emc.atmos.sync.plugins.MultithreadedCrawlSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AtmosSource, FilesystemSource, S3Source
public abstract class MultithreadedCrawlSource
extends SourcePlugin

This class implements a base for multithreaded sources. This implements a graph-based algorithm for computing task dependencies. Operations to execute should be implemented as TaskNode objects. These objects may have zero or more TaskNodes as parent tasks. The TaskNode will not execute until all of its parent tasks have completed. The general procedure for using this class is:

  1. In your run() method, call initQueue().
  2. Create one or more TaskNode object. Add these to the "graph" property.
  3. Start execution by calling runQueue(). This will exit when all tasks have completed.
Note that tasks can in turn spawn child tasks. Also, when processing a "flat" list of objects, it may be needed to throttle input to keep the graph to a reasonable size (e.g. 10x - 100x threadCount).

Author:
cwikj
See Also:
for a sample of throttling input., TaskNode

complete

public void complete(SyncObject obj)
Call this method from your TaskNode on success. It will update the internal statistics for printing the summary at the end of execution.

Parameters:
obj - the SyncObject that has completed successfully.

failed

public void failed(SyncObject obj,
                   Throwable t)
Call this method from your TaskNode on failure. It will update the internal statistics for printing the summary at the end of execution.

Parameters:
obj - the object that has failed
t - the Exception that caused the failure.

parseOptions

public boolean parseOptions(org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine line)
Description copied from class: SyncPlugin
Called from the CLI to parse the given command line. This method should inspect the given options to see whether this plugin should be used and if so, extract any other options it needs to configure iself. If the plugin should be included, return true. If an argument has an invalid setting, you can throw an IllegalArgumentException here.

Specified by:
parseOptions in class SyncPlugin
Parameters:
line - The arguments passed from the command line.
Returns:
true if this plugin should be activated.

printStats

public void printStats()
Description copied from class: SourcePlugin
Print statistics about the transfers to stdout. This will be called by the main AtmosSync2 class after run() has completed to print a summary to the console.

Specified by:
printStats in class SourcePlugin
